abstract.text: A type that represents how a view should change when a pointer hovers
over a view, or when someone looks at the view.

inlineContent.text: Custom hover effects apply their inactive values when the effect is
inactive, and their active values when the effect is active. For example,
the following effect causes a view to be partially transparent when
inactive, but animate to fully opaque when active:
This effect can be applied to a view using the
Hover effects do not affect a view’s layout, and may be applied to a view
out-of-process. Therefore an effect’s current phase may not be visible

SwiftUI-PageImage-card.png.alt: A black Swift logo on a swirly blue and purple background.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
The default hover effect based on the surrounding context.
A type that represents how a view should change when a pointer hovers
over a view, or when someone looks at the view.
The type of effect representing the body of this effect. When you create
a custom effect, Swift infers this type from your implementation of the
required
method.
The content effect type passed to
The default hover effect based on the surrounding context.
Defines the effect produced by this effect.
An effect that applies no changes when hovered.
A hover effect that highlights views using a light source to indicate
position.
Applies this effect in parallel with the given
Applies a hover effect based on the current phase.
Disables this hover effect.
Activates this effect as part of an effect group.
Activates this effect as part of an effect group.
A hover effect that slides the pointer under the view and disappears as
the view scales up and gains a shadow.
A base hover effect used to build additional effects.
An empty base effect that you use to build other effects.
A behavior that can be applied to the hand pointer while the user is
interacting with a view.
A hover effect that highlights views using a light source to indicate
position.
An effect applied when the pointer hovers over a view.
A type that describes the effects of a view for a particular hover
effect phase.
Describes a grouping of effects that activate together.
A hover effect that slides the pointer under the view and disappears as the
view scales up and gains a shadow.
A value with a modifier applied to it.
Sets the behavior of the hand pointer while the user is interacting with
the view.
Applies a hover effect to this view.
Applies a hover effect to this view, optionally adding it to a
Applies a hover effect to this view described by the given closure.
Adds an implicit
to all effects defined on
descendant views, so that all effects added to subviews activate as a
group whenever this view or any descendant views are hovered.
Adds a
to all effects defined on descendant views,
and activates the group whenever this view or any descendant views are

to all effects defined on descendant views,
